alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Fillmore; Houston; Mower; Olmsted; Wabasha; Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 23 at 3:13AM CST until December 24 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Blizzard Conditions Still Possible... .Winds will increase later today and remain strong into tonight with gusts of 45 to 50 mph expected at times. This may be enough to produce blizzard conditions and whiteouts, especially across southeast Minnesota, northeast Iowa and the open area of western into north-central Wisconsin. Wind chills will remain dangerously to bitterly cold through tonight. Wind chills will be the coldest this morning with values of 35 to 45 below zero. Frostbite can occur in as little as 10 minutes in these conditions. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 45 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions.

area.areaDesc: Dodge; Fillmore; Houston; Mower; Olmsted; Wabasha; Winona
